website_summaries.verdict: 3-layer mat, grid, and tray system for indoor or outdoor use.
pros: Can be quickly and easily rinsed out with soap and water
cons: For puppies or small to medium sized dogs only
Grass layer is not attached, so some pups took to digging or playing with it

customer_reviews.title: The best tool for potty training in an apartment
customer_reviews.text: The best tool for potty training in an apartment! We put it on the balcony and it's been working great.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! We live in a small apartment with balcony. We got a small puppy and needed something other than laying puppy pads all over the house. I noticed he was consistent with going in the puppy pads so once I got this grass patch, he automatically started to pee on it instead. He refuses to poop on it still but oh well, we are working on it. There's NO URINE SMELL at ALL that comes from it. I put a puppy pad between the grass and the base for super easy clean up. He pees on the grass and it goes through the grid onto the puppy pad! I rinse it down in the shower and that's that!
customer_reviews.author: Amaz-ing

customer_reviews.title: GET YOUR HAND ON THE MEDIUM ONE NO MATTER HOW TINY YOUR DOGGIE IS!
customer_reviews.text: We bought two, one medium size and one small size for our 3lbs pomerarian puppy. He literally got used to potty on the medium one on the day it delivered, but NEVER used the small one. We were glad that we picked both cuz the medium one had less plastic-ish smell and the artificial grasses were a lil bit softer comparing to the small one. Our puppy is always so picky when it comes to the grasses quality but he loves this product. But it do have some grasses come off easily so make sure you slightly shake before given to your baby. So far SO GOOD!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Dogs ate it
customer_reviews.text: My puppies (2 mini dachshunds 3 months) showed no interest in this product. Put it in with them when I went to town and they peed and pooped next to it and proceeded to chew it up. I figured it would take a while to get them to use it properly but no chance now. Green fake grass is everywhere and I just hope they didn't eat too much to warrant a trip to the vet later. Thought it would be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE SMELL
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to have an option for our unvaccinated puppy to be completely in the house and thought this would be a great option-and it was at first. She went potty on it right away and preferred it over normal training pads. But the smell was horrible. I tried using vinegar, enzymes, and even bleach. My throat was closing up from the smell. We had to throw it away and go back to normal pee pads. If we'd had a safe patio/outside area it would have worked much better but since she was inside only we just couldn't handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Muzik Fan

customer_reviews.title: BAD MANUFACTURED DESIGNED, and poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I would not purchase this item again neither do I promote or recommend the sale. FIRST the grass keep shredding apart each time I wash it, and it do smell even after washing. SECOND the inside tray is very flimsy, and not manufactures to keep the dog urine away from the large bottom tray. BAD MANUFACTURED DESIGNED! Therefore the inside flimsy tray is sitting in the dog urine making things messy and smelly. I have one where the designer has the inside tray mounted away from the bottom tray keeping the dog urine away from the inside tray and grass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice for an apartment
customer_reviews.text: I work 12 hour shifts so I wanted something that my dog could use that wouldn’t be the carpet in case she has an accident. She took to it right away and uses it occasionally. She usually can hold her bladder okay. My only complaint is I live in an apartment so it’s somewhat difficult to clean without access to a hose and the turf can fall off in small pieces at times. Otherwise, it would be awesome and easy to clean outside with a hose or something like that. It absorbs well and doesn’t smell.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Jansen

customer_reviews.title: False advertising ...
customer_reviews.text: By looking at the picture, you'd think that the pad is much bigger than it actually is ... An average lab is about as tall as this pad is long - 24". Here's what the picture should REALLY look like ... Unless you have a small dog or a dog with very good aim, what's actually going to happen is they will put their feet on the grass and proceed to successfully poop to the side of it ...
customer_reviews.author: Scott Pallesen

customer_reviews.title: Dog use it
customer_reviews.text: Dogs use it. I wish they could come out with a fake grass which would better absorb the urine smells. This one washes easily and all, but still I can smell the urine from the dogs. If left in the sun, it does better, but with winter in our grips, one can't do that as much. Others have been worse. I love the size as we had a smaller one the dogs would miss. Our two dogs both use this at night and it is very good for that.
customer_reviews.author: Neoma W.

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, bad execution
customer_reviews.text: PROS: - makes potty training in an apartment (with a balcony) a breeze without depending on potty pads indoors (which led to way too many indoor accidents not on the pad) CONS: - awkward size requires two pee pads underneath - not easy clean thoroughly - pee does not drain through the grass into the tray. Picking up the grass leads to massive pee pooling down the sides. - even after rinsing + cleaning the scent is unbearable after a couple of weeks of use - to the point where my puppy does not want to use it and pees next to it. Will be trying the fresh grass delivery next.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gan

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I have a small dog in potty training and currently live on the third floor of my apartment building, which makes it very difficult. This product has VERY much improved that experience, and my dog has no problems using it! I no longer have to worry about cleaning my carpets whenever there is an accident and we can't make it downstairs in time. Easy to clean, using a potty pad underneath helps for pee cleanup and poop typically comes up quite easily with a paper towel. I have washed it with a hose a few times and it holds up! Will definitely re-order if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: The price is too high now
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this product three stars because although this product does work for my dog, no matter how much you clean it is still smells. I clean it at least three times a week and use a spray that is meant for artificial grass and pets but it still smells. I end up buying about four of these a year, but now that the price is $10 more than it was the last time I purchased it in November I will have to find another place to buy this or an alternative dog potty.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: I can't let her out as often as she needs to go out so this is a wonderful alternative. She uses it often
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old dog developed Cushings Disease and is having a difficult time not urinating in my home. She was going near the doors, so I know she was trying not to go inside. I can't let her out as often as she needs to go out so this is a wonderful alternative. She uses it often. I have noticed that it retains a bad smell unless it is cleaned VERY regularly. I fill my bathtub with laundry detergent and bleach and soak it in hot water for about 30 minutes every other day. That seems to do the trick. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Loryn

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. Stink and very difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I relay the concerns of some negative reviews. Most pee stays in the grass and does not go in the tray. The dogs walks in it and you end up with pee all around your place. Stink after 4 days while we washed it thoroughly everyday using water hose. Difficult to clean and dry. You end up with pee everywhere and likely on you. Still stink after 2 hours in bleach and water bath. Our dog did not want to use it after a week probably because of the smell. Not sure that UPS will accept a such stinky return...
customer_reviews.author: cbduser

customer_reviews.title: Took a little patience but success!!
customer_reviews.text: I finally got my dog to use it/them. It took a little trick i thought of but it worked. The dog made an accident in the house - I quickly cleaned it with paper towel and saved that soaked paper towel and hid it under the mat. The dog smelled the business and she went on the mat!!!! I also saved a little nugget if you will - places it on the mat and again success! I plan on cleaning the mat with dawn and a hose. The dawn should remove any natural oils that are associated with going potty. Don’t give up hope - these work!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's not for every puppy.
customer_reviews.text: The puppy I bought this for tried to chew the turf. She did her business everywhere but on the potty pad. We put it away for awhile to see if getting a little older would help. She would pee outside so I thought I'd give the artificial potty pad another try. I put the pad in the room where she does her business and put a remnant of it on the pad. I checked the pad today and nothing changed, she went inches away from the pad. Unfortunately, I have missed the window to return this and now I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: leenie

customer_reviews.title: It is a little smaller than I would like
customer_reviews.text: I read the dimensions, and it is the largest size I've been able to find, but I'd like it a little larger. That said, my dog won't get on it, I don't know why. If she is home for many hours, she uses a potty pad if she needs to go, and sometimes through the night, but I can't get her to step on this. Since I'm still strong enough to take her outside, it isn't a major problem, but I may have to put two together to make her more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: J Silvasy

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh Again it’s a hit or miss So you would ...
customer_reviews.text: Ehhh Again it’s a hit or miss So you would have to take the chance if you feel this may be for you. The pups definitely doesn’t think this is grass and it doesn’t really help because they could smell the plastic I guess I think the potty paper atract them more, what I did was just use the black tray and put a potty paper inside This did work for them to learn to go in the middle of the paper and not in the corner so the pee doesn’t travel to the floor since they have to sorta step in
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Cute rug, not ideal as a "puppy potty"
customer_reviews.text: I got this originally got this as a "puppy potty" for my balcony, I have a 13yr old chihuahua. I wasn't able to have her successfully go on it, she would just sit on it like a rug. But I really liked the quality of it so I didn't return it and ended up using it as a rug for her bowls. It does have a bit of a shine to it but overall I liked the look of it so much considered buying a few more as an area rug for my balcony.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Usable
customer_reviews.text: Definitely should’ve ordered a bigger size however the Labrador on the picture was a little deceiving. I have three dogs, a German Shepherd, a schnauzer terrier mix a pug Maltese mix. Originally bought it for my German Shepherd for a houseboat trip we went on, she absolutely refused to use it in fact jumped off of the boat and swim to shore in order to use the restroom. My pug Maltese seems to have it down 80% of the time. If you are not trying to clean it every day I do recommend potty pad inside to absorb and use caution while taking it outside to clean up as to not spill anything you don’t want to spilled.😉
customer_reviews.author: deborah hare

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small puppy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a new 11 week old Shorkie and she much prefers the "grass" to the puppy pads for going potty. She was notably excited when I got this out of the box! I set it near her spot and while I was wiping the floor down, she went ahead and used it. I love that this has a tray to easily clean in the bathtub or outside with a hose. The size is perfect for a small puppy. She has enough room to turn around until she finds the right spot. The grass stays put inside the tray. Definitely recommend! Also, thanks for shipping ahead of schedule!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works very very good for training a puppy. I use potty absorbent pads under the grass. For the first week I did not clean it so that the puppy was attracted to it to use it often. Now I spray with with urine cleaner spray and set just grass outside when it rains to clean it. No smell yet. However, older dog chewed up plastic liner pad that holds the extra urine. Not a big deal because we are using disposable potty pads. I also have a rug gripper under tray to keep it from sliding around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falls short of expectations, good concept in theory
customer_reviews.text: We purchase this for our lab puppy to help with potty training and longer times at home alone during work days. He unfortunately just pulls the artificial grass off the pad which pretty much instantly defeats the whole concept. I wish there was a way to secure the artificial grass layer to the bottom of the pad. While he's only 4 months old currently it only takes about 2 pees to make everything soggy. I tried placing an additional absorbent pad underneath but as it's not really designed of that wasn't surprised that it didn't work well/help.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Z.

customer_reviews.title: Good for sloppy drinkers
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs are very sloppy drinkers, especially the younger one. We were constantly sopping up puddles of water or walking through them. With the Grass Bathroom Mat (and taking away the more open topped water dish) we now only have to clean small spills on the floor sometimes, and change the potty mat under the grass once a week. So much better than before. Not what it was designed for, but it's working for us.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Mason

customer_reviews.title: It works. Dogs use it. BUT it sucks to clean it.
customer_reviews.text: I live in an appartment. I keep in balcony for when I cannot take dogs on walk. I wish it was a bit larger. UPDATE I stop using it. The smell of the urine is inbearable once it collects for more than a few days. Cleaning is a hands on mess. It would be better if it had no tray so that liquid would evaporate and then one could clean. But the tray keeps urine from evaporating, leaving a mess to clean afterwards. Intead. I got a large outdoor comercial washable mat (like the ones on entry doors). This works perfect. It is easier to hose down once a week and it allows for liquids to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Juan A.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: At first, my dog just enjoyed sitting on it, so I dabbed a little yellow stuff... you know... with a paper towel and then she used it. I will say that I don't like the cleanup. I took it outside and pulled up the inner tray and the wind splattered urine all over. I think I'll put a puppy pad or something in the bottom to keep it from being a tray of liquid. Otherwise, we've washed it out several times and we've had no problems with a nasty smell, etc.... This thing has been a life saver! I have 12 and 13 year old dachshunds and we wanted something for emergencies when we couldn't get home in time.
customer_reviews.author: JEF

customer_reviews.title: they worked great..
customer_reviews.text: So I have a new puppy and although he likes to do his business outside, when it is cold or rainy (we live in michigan) its a problem so I bought 1, and then bought 2 more... they worked great... until the smell! I just cannot clean the smell out... its like the urine has penetrated the plastic and to put it mildy it smells putrid. If it was a urine smell I could live with it... but this is some kind of plastic decomp! reading thru the comments I am going to try a bleach soak and see if that helps otherwise I'm going to demand a refund from the manufacturer and try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Satko

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: So far, I guess this has worked, only not in the way intended. My dog had been pooping in the house...., I've got 2 feral 6 year old daughters , a more than full time "essential job", and no help with chores, So I gave up training and decided to just let it be. Put this in her potty spot and..... Now she doesn't go in the house anymore! Victory? Aside from that, it seems well made. The "grass" pad sheds a little, but so do dogs, so no biggie there. Will update if she uses it.
customer_reviews.author: kt4000

customer_reviews.title: Dog took right to it!
customer_reviews.text: We love the grass! Our puppy is potty trained for outside but having the grass helps when she is home alone during the day or when it is raining outside. It saves my rugs!!!! It is easy to clean. I spray a little Nature's Miracle and hose it off and all is good. I saw negative reviews about the grass...I think people forget you will need to replace the grass over time. We replace every couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: sherrie Achors

customer_reviews.title: Our puppy loved it so much we bought another!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a townhouse with no grass yard, our puppy is only 8 weeks old and does not have her parvo shots yet so she cannot go onto public surfaces yet so we got this to help her get potty trained. The day we brought her home she went straight to the “grass” and went potty, she has loved the “grass” so much that we bought her a second one! Could not recommend this enough! While researching this product I read a lot of the amazon reviews and saw that people had suggested putting their puppy pads under the grass to make cleaning easier and we have done that and been really happy with the results!
customer_reviews.author: cheerupemokid99

customer_reviews.title: I’m so glad I bought this!!
customer_reviews.text: Life saver!!!!!! My 8 week old puppy uses this all the time! She picked up on it so quickly. We live in an apartment on the second floor and the potty grass area in the complex is on the other side. I make sure the take her outside frequently but sometimes she just has to go. She goes to it immediately and has only had one or two accidents inside. I just wash it off in the shower and let it dry and it’s good to go. If you have a puppy you need to get one of these. Or even an older dog that can’t hold it while you’re gone.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: This thing sheds - big time!
customer_reviews.text: My pad has never been used because my dog will not arrive until mid-October. But I placed it in the spot it was planned for and all seemed well - until I picked it up to sweep around the area. The "grass" began to fall to the floor and went all over the place! I did not realize that would happen and would never have paid almost $50 for a product that was doomed to disappear in short order! Unfortunately, I did not check it until the deadline to return had passed. Too bad for me. What a rip-off.
customer_reviews.author: ravesandhowls

customer_reviews.title: Defective item
customer_reviews.text: This item has no purpose. It is hard and points on a puppy's private parts to even use. It was not good at all, it hurt his little private parts, to say the least. And the top part which is the grass does not stay in the holder properly. I became sick and took treatments for sick months, and this was the last thing on my mind. I don't have to shop on amazon, since I have spent thousands of dollars in the last few years. I request a refund or credit for this product. Thank you in Advance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to keep clean!
customer_reviews.text: While my two puppies are potty trained to go outside when we are home and two sliding glass doors are left open - One of the pups is only 3 pounds and can't get in and out the dog door quite yet when we aren't home. Potty pads were not a solution as she thought any rug was also a potty pad. After purchasing this product - she used it exclusively while we not at home which made things a lot easier and more sanitary. Very easy to spray down and clean and more appealing than potty pads all over the house. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Drake

customer_reviews.title: great product. affordable price. highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Ordered after we took our puppy home from the rescue. They were already using something similar and I def recommend this over the pads. It was a perfect fit for our small balcony too! The only downside for me is emptying it. I usually pour it into a red cup and then transfer to the toilet. once a month I put it in the bathtub and hose it down really give it a thorough clean. I have a mat for our pup to wipe his feet before he comes back in because they are usually wet from stepping on it. Also it can definitely stink and attract many bugs and maggot type so it is little gross.
customer_reviews.author: The Real Deal - Tested & Approved !

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetically pleasing and practical!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the way it looks compared to potty pads, bark potty’s, or other potty training accessories. Introduction: My puppy wasn’t too sure about it at first, and then I put a used potty pad underneath the grass layer of the potty so she would smell where to go and also put a fresh puppy pad underneath the 2nd layer of the tray to help absorb some of the urine. Now she knows where to go! Cleaning: Take outside to hose down! Quick and easy!
customer_reviews.author: hk

customer_reviews.title: Great potty solution
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old dog. We don't want him using the grass in our front yard so I bought this as a solution. He had no issues using it from the first try. I rinse it off each day and let it dry overnight. I would recommend this for puppies or small to medium dogs.
customer_reviews.author: jenerationmama

customer_reviews.title: I'm satisfied nevertheless.
customer_reviews.text: I got mine this weekend. I did not force my dog to use it & I wasn't sure if she will ever be. Well I stayed home today & checked the grass lo & behold it's wet, but still to be sure I tested it with paper towel & it turned yellow, definitely she peed WOW! Now I wish that there's an option to buy ONLY the grass so I can change it everyday while the other is drying for the next use. Petmaker are you reading this? I don't need another complete set, just the grass please? I don't want my house to smell dog pee either. I'm satisfied nevertheless. UPDATE: my dog is cocker spaniel, 30 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!... I have 2 dogs at home, the old one (15yo) I inherited and never potty trained and a puppy that we are working on it. Well... We got this so the puppy could learn only to pee in the grass, only to discovered that this actually also helped the old one!!... Now the old one that fro some reason doesn't pee outside no matter how long you walk her, its only peeing in this pad (instead of all over). I find this to be a fantastic product, great size and quality. easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: A great transition pad, however.
customer_reviews.text: We upgraded to this device when our lab decided to start chewing up pee pads. It worked great once she discovered its purpose. Unfortunately, that much urine and poop comes with one nasty side effect. Doggie kitty litter smell. It must be cleaned every 6 hours unless you like the smell of stale fish-sticks and cigarettes. Additionally as many commentors have claimed that grass piece is gross. We ended up throwing it away. #epicgagreflex. It works but be prepared for some extra work.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hoven

customer_reviews.title: My Chihuahua loves it
customer_reviews.text: I've been having trouble with my 4 month old chihuahua going potty on the carpet, shes not great about alerting when she needs to potty and when we do go outside she is more interested in sniffing and eating sticks. She used this right away! I did put potty pads underneath the turf so that I don't have to hose down the capture tray as often. the medium is big enough for my 5lb chihuahua to walk around a tiny bit and go potty comfortably. Would definitely recommend this for people with dogs who are having trouble with potty training.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie Giannaula

customer_reviews.title: Useful for Apartment Dogs and Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loves this and so do I! I have an 8 week old puppy and I live in a small 1 bedroom apartment on the 2nd floor, so no yard. I wanted something that would simulate going outside but wouldn’t take up much room and would be easy to clean. It stays really dry on the surface even if she has used it several times in a day. She loves to lay on it so dryness is important. The tray is very easy to clean and holds a lot of liquid.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Pup took right to using this. No training needed.
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a dog that would use training pads or papers. They usually just tear them up and make a mess. Our new pup took right to going on grass, so I figured this might work, and sure enough, she uses it as long as it's nearby. This has saved me from cleaning up a lot of accidents. She only uses it for #1, which is fine since she seems to be able to hold #2 til we get her outside. I think it's hard to be sure wether your dog will use this or not, but if they are used to going on grass, they seem to take right to this.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works like a CHARM
customer_reviews.text: Ok - I just got this delivered today and immediately follow the advise some other reviewers posted (ie using training pad under grass mat, getting rid of lose grass) and I must say I’M IMPRESSED and totally recommend this... Initially, he played on it then started chewing/removing the grass mat but after securing it in place IT WAS A HIT (on the 1st day) - we just put his soiled puppy pad under it for the scent and TADA worked like a CHARM!!! One CON: I wish the grass mat had a way to secure it to the base (clipping/velcro) so puppies can’t pull it off!
customer_reviews.author: Viv

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The middle layer that supports the grass top is supposed to drain into the pan below, where I planned to put potty pads for easy clean up. The drain holes are far apart and few which would keep the waste on the middle layer more than funneling to the tray and potty pad below. Appears that it would be considerably more clean up and not worth the hassle so it was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Lizard Leg

customer_reviews.title: How to keep it clean from odors
customer_reviews.text: I loved it for my small dog however if dog urine is strong I sit the mat in tub and use arm and hammer laundry detergent. To get rid of smell other times I use the cleaning vinegar. Bought indoor out door carpet and cut in size to was one and have clean one. I also use potty spray so dog goes back to it. Been using this method for 3 years for my in house dog. Best thing in the world I bought. I also put a plastic sheet underneath because I found she won’t do #2 on it but over the side of it which makes cleaning easy. Buy it you won’t be sorry
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and very effective.
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 small dogs and they were already trained to go out and use the yard. We were tired of the mess they brought in on their paws, holes they were digging and tompolling down my new plants. As soon as I set these up (I bought 2) they went directly to them. I put a potty pad directly under the artificial grass which makes clean up a breeze. They are easily rinsed out and set back up. I'm very happy we found these and I can understand many other circumstances where they would help the dog owner.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: Thankful we bought this!!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 week old mini Aussie uses this in lieu of going out sometimes. We both love it!! Looks more pleasing than a pee pad (which we do insert between the grass and the drain system). The dog is thankful for those emergency times, and so am I. BEST THING is the fact I use Dawn dish soap and a utility sink; with a just bit of pressured water it run the soapy water through and clean it like new in a matter of minutes. Gosh- this Nebraska girl sounds like a paid sponsor (I AM NOT)- may the potty training be ever in your favour....
customer_reviews.author: Twin Momaha

customer_reviews.title: It stinks, but your old, incontinent dog will probably pee on this instead of ruining the subfloor
customer_reviews.text: This worked great when my ex wife's dog got diagnosed with incurable cancer, and got put on medication that made her pee constantly. Yes, it smelled to high heaven and had to be hosed out every other day or so, but at least the dog peed on it, and it caught the urine. She was always a good dog until the end, but she was peeing everywhere when I bought this thing. It was an investment that solved the problem for which it was intended. I put it in her pee spot, and she started using it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: D. Michael McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Think of something different!
customer_reviews.text: This thing really does not work and it is very very difficult to clean. I just missed my window to return it because I wanted to give it a fair chance. I bought two of them and have five dogs. They have doggy doors but I thought for the days it rains or at night it would be easier, none of them liked this much. When I did get them to use it, ugh, cleaning it is horrible!!!! Wish I could return it, not worth the money I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Livvy

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s supoosed to do, our older dog wasn’t a big fan
customer_reviews.text: We tried this for my older dog, she’s 12 and no longer has great control of her bladder, so she has accidents at night. It took her a while to be comfortable enough to use it, and when she did we found that she would only use it once and wouldn’t pee on it again if she had already used it. The top part moves when she steps off and i think she didn’t like that. It does what’s its meant to do though, and probably works great for puppies to potty train. For us though we just went back to potty pads and that’s working a little better
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Neubauer

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED in quality
customer_reviews.text: Not happy! No real absorbency, I ended up putting potty pad under grass. Grass mat had shed like a dead Christmas tree since coming out of the box. Tired of picking up pieces of grass. Liner in between smelled upon arrival, thought maybe new plastic smell but just won’t fade or wash out. I don’t mind cleaning up after a 4 pound little dog but I don’t want to sweep grass every day.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle in FL

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy I decided to purchase this product! Especially considering I was hesitant to try it since I didn't want my pup going indoors, but between the apartment living and those rainy days I needed a buffer. My puppy went right on it the first day I put it down. He has not went in my apartment or crate since and it doesn't have an odor! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: He loves it! Just not for peeing ha ha
customer_reviews.text: I live in a high rise and I was slightly worried my older dog would need to pee more often. I have a tiny balcony so I thought to get this for emergencies. Well neither of my dogs use it for peeing lol but he LOVES to lay on it in the sun. In its defense: both my dogs are super potty trained and I think they just feel the balcony is too much like home to be peeing on it, and I am actually glad about that, as I don't want to train in a bad habit. But at least it is there if needed.
customer_reviews.author: EuropeanCaliGRL

customer_reviews.title: Great for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver for use with my 6.5 pound Chihuahua. I work all day and can't expect a little one to "hold it" that long. Plus, my dog is not a fan of rain or snow! I have a male dog and found he needed something to aim at. I found a small plastic fire hydrant on another website, specifically for this purpose. It's a great combo. I recommend buying more than one mat, though. One to be in use and one that is being washed in the laundry tub and then air dried, which can take a day or 2.
customer_reviews.author: MEK57Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for puppy training
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for my puppys playpen. Cleaned it every couple days and it never held a smell. I definitely recommend this product. My puppy used it every time and never had accidents in her indoor pen. I did have to use bitter apple spray on the edges after washing and drying it to keep her from tearing it up. But the two of those together worked great for my goldendoodle.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: It Can Work
customer_reviews.text: My puppy is still only 4.5 months old, but she goes on her mat for the most part when I can't be home to let her out. Yes, the "grass" does get stinky, but I find that if I hose it down twice a week , set it in the sun to dry, and keep fresh puppy pads between the "grass" and the drainage mat, it helps. But truly, you'll need to change those pads daily, hose down the "grass" frequently, and air it out.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: I’m still undecided on this one. The idea is great! But the execution needs some work. It would be nice if the grass was somehow held down. My dog just grabs a corner and pulls it all around. That’s annoying. He wouldn’t use it at first. He rather lay on it and chill. I hate to put it in his crate to get him to use it at first. Now he uses it on a regular basis but still drags the grass around intermittently. If they could figure out some snaps, clips or some way to make the grass stay down, this would be 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Turf pad
customer_reviews.text: When we bring our dog on the truck I got one of these because of bad weather or poor conditions where my dog has to walk. I put a dog pad underneath and let my little chiweenie use this since some folks don't know how-to pick up their dogs poop at the rest areas and truck stops. Also in snow and rain it's so much easier to use this then bringing Vinny in wet grass or snow (poor little guy). This is a blessing for us, if you travel alot with a small dog you may want to consider it too. I keep it in my sleeper box where its accessible from outside the truck
customer_reviews.author: O_U_Contrary2

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent! Best thing I've bought for my dog!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 wk old puppy took about 3 seconds to use this. I don't know if he's a genius or what, but there was absolutely no coaching or training for him. He's never had an accident in the house because of this product, and I am unbelievably happy about that because it took me a year to convince my husband we needed a puppy. My only complaint, and its not really a big deal to be honest, the urine doesn't seem to seep through the carpet into the tray. I wash the carpet every other day to keep the smell away, but I have to dab at it to soak up any moisture. But it really is a wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie L.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: This is great in concept...however my dachshund would often pee at the edge...which means the urine would run under the entire underside of the tray. So instead of just cleaning a little puddle I would have to clean the entire bottom of the tray (while trying not to let anything from the top run out) and the entire floor under the tray. It ended up being easier to just use puppy pads until he was fully potty trained.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Owen

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog owners with limited mobility
customer_reviews.text: I got this pee pad when I got my puppy. It was really helpful in potty training because he quickly learned how to use it and if I wasn't fast enough in getting him outside this prevented accidents on our carpet. My dog is fully potty trained now but we still use it because I have mobility problems and when I can't get him outside my dog knows this is where he can go potty inside. It can be a lot of work to clean though, but I think it's worth it. Definitely try it if you have a hard time getting your dog outside quickly when they need it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best product ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 13 wk old Boston Terrier puppy and he took to it 1st thing. You just have to clean it often so you don't have the lingering smell of old pee seeping through. Use hot soapy water and rinse it off, leave it outside to dry, and whal-la, new again. It has 2 layers so it is a lot to rinse off but so worth it. It still looks new! This is the best product on the market. I only wish I had it for my other small dogs when they were babys. I beleive you can buy new "grass" for it but I have washed mine several times and it is good still.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Dominey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect item for apartments with porch/balcony.
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews, I took the advice of placing absorbent puppy pads underneath the mat. GREAT ADVICE! Some reviewers complain about the smell and difficulty cleaning them, but to me - they are a temporary product that is meant to be thrown away after a couple months. I don’t even try to clean them! Yuck! I have two side by side outside for a medium dog. This item is fantastic. Oh but wait for the poo to dry before picking it up!
customer_reviews.author: TLALONDE16

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY SOMETHING THAT WORKED
customer_reviews.text: It took like 2 weeks, but my baby finally has a place to go in case of emergencies. She was peeing all over the carpet and I tried to train her to go on the wee wee pads for months to no avail. At first she didn't really understand the point of it so I took some dirt from outside and sprinkled some of it on it. That's when it clicked!!!! Now she doesn't go any where else. i can believe she's finally trained. It;s so easy to clean too, what I did is I put the wee wee pad under the grass pad so when she goes I just switch it now no washing or wiping involved. PERRRRFFFECCCCTTT
customer_reviews.author: nati

customer_reviews.title: Great as a muddy paw cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t need this for potty training. I got it on a whim to try an easier way to keep my two large pawed dogs clean of dirt and muck before we let them back in. I removed the center grid tray and put the grass and a gallon+ of water in and walked them across a couple times before drying their feet. Best investment I’ve made in a long time. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Drains slowly but works!
customer_reviews.text: I have this in a the same sized plastic tray. I line the tray with a pee pad and then put this grass on top. I was using real grass and my dog transitioned to this version pretty easily. Once a week, I take it outside and spray it down with the hose. I also recommend an enzyme cleaner spray because it does start to stink after being drenched in dog pee all the time.
customer_reviews.author: angeljesso

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is awful. Was shredding strings and artificial grass on arrival. There grass pieces are all over. Super strong chemical smell as well. When washing the grass holds water and strings are unraveling that hold the piece together as one. I wouldn’t recommend at all! I’d also like to mention how unsanitary this is.. my pup smelled of urinate after using this even after I’ve washed it.
customer_reviews.author: WhitneyT89

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these grass pads. It works great for my dog when she goes to a place to be babysat. A just in case at night. Easy clean up if you put the liner underneath the grass. Highly recommend. And definitely buying again. I like to replace mine every couple of months. These help to potty train puppies as well. Everyone said my mini dachshund could never be fully housebroken and these helped her become fully housebroken. Get them used to this and when you see your dog going over here take them outside. Works wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Smelly
customer_reviews.text: Smells pretty bad even though I take it out and wash it every morning. But with a young puppy that wakes up every 2 hours through the night wanting to be taken out, this stinky mat at least helps me get a little less broken sleep. I've seen the same fake grass mats at the big hardware store sold by the foot. Maybe once the smell is unbearable, I'll recycle this one for another.
customer_reviews.author: gd

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend. Use washable or one use training/pee pads instead.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. Dog used it, yes, but its hard to clean, and even after washing it after every use, after a few days it smells awful. I washed it every time my dog pee on it. Had to wait for it to dry, and use training pads while it dried. Then to avoid the washing started using pads on top of it or under the “green” which doesn’t help its purpose. Now it is unused taking space in the corner of storage.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and insufficient
customer_reviews.text: The artificial grass pad tends to hold/absorb the smell. I have used several different artificial grass systems for my two small dogs. This is probably the worst so far, so much so that my dogs are chosing to pee along side it rather than on it. To make matters worse, I looked on here to find replacement grass to see if maybe this was an option....no dice. Seller only carries the small size replacement. I have had this about 3 months and am plenty ready to toss it off of the balcony.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Martello

customer_reviews.title: Tootsie really does use this
customer_reviews.text: My 18 year old dog learned to use this very quickly. I moved to an apartment w a patio and this is her nighttime or rainy weather potty. I lined the astro turf w a potty pee pad so it's easy and quick to change. I take the astro turf out to the yard area for a once a week washing. This has made life a lot easier for both of us. And we don't have to go out late at night for a potty run in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: tea drinker

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it, you need real grass
customer_reviews.text: You're better off buying a plot of real grass for your apt balcony. I bought this for my new puppy bc I live in a highrise & the dog refuses to do anything with it but chew it bc it's plastic. I had already started potty training him before I bought it so he associated the real grass as his place to go. If you wanted this to work, you'd have to start him from day 1 on turf. I wish I hadn't spent the $30.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but not for me
customer_reviews.text: Canine urine smell is pungent and hard to remove even outdoors. My lil dog (4 lbs) was trained to use it in one day and after few weeks the smell got simply repulsive even though it's outside and gets rained on quite a bit (hence rinsed and drained); less than a month and my dog refuses to use it every time. And when he does he brings the smell inside in his paws.
customer_reviews.author: T&M

customer_reviews.title: Cleanup is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my puppy was having a difficult time potty training with a pee pee pad and was constantly ripping it up. I thought this would be perfect to give her the realistic feeling of pooping on grass. I would absolutely not buy this again. Even though she did like the feeling of the grass, cleaning up the mat was EXTREMELY difficult. You can't clean in the washing machine and whatever method you use to clean, the grass falls right off and makes just as much of a mess as your dog does. This is not worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I don’t want to teach him it’s okay to go in the house But!!!..Bought because my dong REFUSES to go out in the rain! He will go out on his own in dry weather but he Hates the rain!! Beats washing the throw rug everyday and this is easy to clean. I just need to get an extra piece of grass so I can put a dry one down while the other is getting cleaned. Puppy pads come in handy for the interim but the potty trainer is definitely more economical and more eye appealing. .
customer_reviews.author: yelkcub

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about this but we will see
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think it’s the same product as advertised... hope it will work. Friend got petmaker trainer same size same company and mine looks nothing like that one. Also the grass part is bigger than the tray maybe an inch. Updating to 4 stars, works fine only the inch different between grass and tray is annoying because dog steps on it and making it sly out of the tray easily
customer_reviews.author: Lidia T

customer_reviews.title: Mobile potty!
customer_reviews.text: My dog took to this right away. My min pin is 13yrs old with a bad hip/knee and normal pee pads were getting to difficult to use. This fake grass texture gave her the "grip" she needed. I have tile floor, I did put foam on the bottom of the tray to give it more stability because of the floor I have. This product is really easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Tomi Omel

customer_reviews.title: Best investment!
customer_reviews.text: Living in the south we have lots of rainy days which means a wet, nasty and smelly dog. My pup would not take to a puppy pad so this product was a life saver! Love the 3 layer system that keeps her feet nice and dry. . . . I placed a puppy pad under the turf for even easier clean up then all you need to do is hose off the grass with some dish soap!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: STINKY
customer_reviews.text: The dog did a great job in using it however the pad didnt hold much urine and after urinating on it they would be standing in the urine. Could not get rid of the smell even after soaping it up good and my darn dog found the plastic grass yo yummy and pooped it out for a week. Was not a good product for a dog who likes to chew on things.
customer_reviews.author: Starr

customer_reviews.title: It really works well for us.
customer_reviews.text: Our yorkie can’t hold it all night for some reason but during the day he always goes outside. We have fake and real grass outside but he used this right away with no training. No more messes in the kitchen.! He wouldn’t use peepee pads. It is fantastic for us. It’s very short fake grass, if there are poops just flush and then we wash everything. No smell so far. We used peepee pads under the grass at first but thought grass would start smelling so we just wash everything daily instead. It’s pretty easy to deal with - then we set it out each evening and no more messes.
customer_reviews.author: slf

customer_reviews.title: Really works.
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old Maltese went to it right away but my 6 year old refuses to use it...🤣 Can’t blame the product. But it really works good for apartments. Just make sure to clean it every couple of days or you will be in for a big surprise with the smell. I suggest to put a puppy pad at the bottom to absorb the liquid and it makes clean up soooooooo much easier. I then spray the tray down with some fabuloso and it works wonders.....
customer_reviews.author: Bernardette

customer_reviews.title: Dream come true
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog that doesn't like wind, rain, hail, sleet, snow, or hot weather. That being said, she as been destroying my carpet and I HATE when I'm walking and step in pee. It has been two successful weeks of no peeing anywhere in the house! I use the AmazonBasics Pet Training and Puppy Pads, Regular - 100 Count mats under the grass so I'm no pouring anything out, and walking through my home with a tray of pee. It holds the odor. My house doesn't smell of pee! Highly recommend getting one if you have a naughty puppy.
customer_reviews.author: David Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great back up for small dog
customer_reviews.text: I have a small dog who is stubborn about potty training. I leave this mat out at night or when I am at work and 99% of the time she uses it instead of going somewhere else in the house. I put the pee pad underneath it to make it easier to clean. It is a good back up if you have a small dog that cannot hold their bladder long and you don't want to get up several times during the night to let them out. My dog is almost two now, and she uses this pretty regularly in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Weldon

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: It took my puppy not too long to use it to go potty there. However, it didn't take too long for him to chew and rip it apart either. Choking hazard!! I would not trust leaving alone my puppy with this. The black tray is very thin! He pooped out fake grass and a chunk of the black plastic. Not to mention that if you don't wash it right away it stinks! Like so much ! In one day it stank so bad. Bought it on Friday and on the trash by Saturday. I would NOT recommend. We're back on the pee pads.
customer_reviews.author: lola

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth Trying for the price!
customer_reviews.text: 1 of my 3 dogs uses it every time now! the other 2 aren't really the best at going to the toilet in the house anyways so was hoping this would help them learn but they don't seem interested :/ However that isn't the products fault it has been awesome to work with, easy to clean, low profile and great quality. It might be a hit or a miss with your dogs but for the price it is definitely worth trying, GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Bosua

customer_reviews.title: Great, gross, but great.
customer_reviews.text: I was in a small apartment and my puppy didn't have his shots so he couldn't venture outside yet because there were many dogs in our complex. Having this on our back patio allowed for early potty training. After he got bigger and no longer needed to be kept indoors he took to using grass fairly quickly. Cleaning poop out of this is no fun, especially if your puppy gets the runs. Other than that if you have a hose, it rinses off pretty easily. I recommend using an absorbent disposable pee pad underneath and changing it daily if you do not plan on washing this every day.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 dogs and only one walked on it the day it came and that’s because she thought I was giving her a treat but she never stepped on it again. The other 3 wouldn’t dare step on it. With that being said my dogs are between the ages of 4 years and 6 so it may work for a puppy that didn’t really know the difference yet! So now the bottom part is used to block them from my dining room. Cheap as well but I don’t know why I expected it to be any different.
customer_reviews.author: StacBow

customer_reviews.title: This works GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This mat is fantastic. I have a 10 week old Yorkie and have had her 1week. I received the pad yesterday and put it in a restricted area close to her crate. Left both of her crate doors open when she went to bed last night around 10pm which was early for her. She wakes up at 7am like clockwork and I took her outside to go as usual. She ran around but did not go. We went back in and I checked the pee pad that I put under the artificial turf and there was a large wet spot in the center of the turf. She instinctively went on her own. I'm super happy with this product...
customer_reviews.author: Freida

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bred a litter of puppies and the thought of the mess of a separate litter area and all the rabbit alfalfa pellets everywhere didn't amuse me. I decided that transistioning them from one type of potty surface to the eventual one (grass outside) was sort of a waste of effort. I put this in the whelping box and BAM- they used it right away. As they grew and moved into a larger play area, it worked just as well - and now - they are asking to go out. It made potty training 5 pups a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: LeeAnn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for house training!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! House trained our 7 week old pup on our patio on this mat! Since she can’t be taken outside yet to keep her safe from parvo and other viruses. Super Easy to clean. We use puppy pads under the grass to switch out and rinse off the grass and plastic part every couple days. It is a tad small but it worked perfectly for what we needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: lauren l.

customer_reviews.title: This works great even better if you use potty pads underneath it
customer_reviews.text: This works great even better if you use potty pads underneath it . I have a 12 yr old bichion and he's potty trained outside so it took him 3 weeks before he would use it, but once they start your good to go. Best thing to do is take the grass outside with you when the dog pees and soak his pee up with the grass that way it has his urine smell that's how I got my dog to use it .
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy H.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for us
customer_reviews.text: The grass is easily knocked off which made this useless for our nosey puppy. If she was left unattended near it, it automatically became a chew toy. She didn’t use it much for its purpose and we had multiple accidents right next to this. This item is decently sturdy and it is also very easy to clean if you use puppy pads under the grass. I think this product is good overall, just not good for us.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Would avoid
customer_reviews.text: The urine does not filter through the turf very well. It is just literal turf grass you can get at like Lowes or Home Depot on top of a boot mat. The urine sits in the turf and will smell. Very hard to clean. My dog used it as a pee pad, but the scent is just impossible to get out of that turf. It's honestly a waste of money, I would just buy a boot mat and some pee pads. Disappointed in this product and honestly shocked at all of the good reviews..
customer_reviews.author: Shasam

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good and a great size for our pup. The grass however, just feels like thin paper streamers but it's doing the job. We also use the puppy pads in between the grass and container to catch the excrement to make things easier since he always goes every hour. Wish there was a better feel to it, like maybe a rubberized feel or something closer to the feeling of actual grass but its working just fine for now! At the price of this grass pad, it's not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: was a good concept, not worth the stench
customer_reviews.text: really wanted to love this. unfortunately the mat is soo poorly made the grass goes everywhere. cleaning it makes an even bigger mess because it just falls off in clumps. the effort to keep the smell at bay even when cleaning regularly is ridiculous. I kept the tray to put pee pads in, but the rest went in the garbage. my 8 week old puppy took to it very quickly which was great, but I can't stand odors and this thing definitely holds them in.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: then get this awesome mat. We literally had our Aussie Puppy trained ...
customer_reviews.text: If you want to potty train your puppy FAST, then get this awesome mat. We literally had our Aussie Puppy trained in 1(ONE) Day with this thing. Love love love this mat and would highly recommend for anyone trying to potty train their puppy!
customer_reviews.author: L. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me but looks like picture
customer_reviews.text: My dog didn't seem to be inclined to use it at all. I mean it's brand new still and I waited too long to return it. customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, wish they were a little bigger though
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE THESE!!!! I ordered two for my chihuahua (he’s very tiny) and it took him a little while, but now he goes on my apartment balcony and it’s so much easier than taking him outside all the time. Only thing is that these were smaller than I thought.. so I bought a turf rug from Home Depot for $20 and then put 2 of these on top of that. customer_reviews.author: Sam
